metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7448 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
The Utah RLE reader in GraphicsMagick before 1.3.25 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption or large memory allocations) via vectors involving the header information and the file size. It was discovered that GraphicsMagick incorrectly handled certain image files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7448` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.25-1
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.25-1
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.25-1
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.3.25-1
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.3.25-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.25-1').
